title: 5 Shoe Color Trends All the Cool French Girls Are Wearing This Summer
author: Allyson Payer
excerpt: If you're looking for the best summer shoe colors, your search ends here. These are the five shoe color trends chic French women are wearing.
text: I think we can all agree that if a cool French girl wears something, it's probably worth investing in—or at least investigating. Simply put, they have great taste and gravitate toward trends that they can wear over and over (and they do). This summer in particular, something I've noticed chic French women aren't wearing that much is black shoes. Instead, they're opting for shoes in colors that are more unexpected, that a unique touch to their summer outfits, whether they lean neutral or colorful.The five shoe color trends, in particular, that are favorites of the French this summer are all in keeping with the overarching color trends of 2025, and even the more bold hues miraculously look good with everything. Needless to say, I don't think any fashion people in Paris are missing their black shoes this summer. Keep scrolling to shop the five main shoe color trends they're prioritizing instead.RedAt this point, red shoes have gone from major trend to wardrobe staple. As you can see from Anne Laure-Mais here, they can completely transform an outfit in a way that few other shoe colors can. Red flats and flip-flops, in particular, are dominating this summer.Shop Red Shoes for Summer Open Edit Tori Kitten Heel Sandals Coach Sculpted C Flat Sandals Tory Burch Eyelet Mary Jane Ballet Flats Baby BlueOn the softer end of the color spectrum is baby blue, which is the shade that's captured the attention of Parisians, even more so than butter yellow and powder pink. As you can see below, they pair particularly well with white pieces.Shop Baby Blue Shoes for Summer Reformation Waldena Block Heeled Mules Nordstrom Naiomi Ankle Strap Sandals Christopher Esber Jo Thong Sandals Shopbop Mansur Gavriel Woven Ballerina Flats EspressoEspresso, aka chocolate brown, continues to be the reigning neutral color trend of 2025. IMO, it makes outfits look expensive and can be worn year-round. Sounds like a must-own shoe color to me.Shop Espresso Shoes for Summer Sam Edelman Elaina T-Strap Flats Jeffrey Campbell Chrissy Slingback Sandals Madewell The Ruth Ballet Flat in Woven Leather ZARA Wide Heeled Leather Sandals SAINT LAURENT Le Loafer Logo-Embellished Suede Loafers CreamStark white shoes are a classic, but the more elegant option that French fashion people are opting for this summer is cream shoes. Whether in leather, mesh, or satin in the form of heels, flats, sneakers, or sandals, cream is always a smart choice for summer footwear.Shop Cream Shoes for Summer Jeffrey Campbell Trustee Pumps Franco Sarto Destin Slingback Flats Staud Alba Cream Crochet Ballet Flats Alohas Amar Cream Leather Mules MANGO Leather Boat Shoes With Laces BurgundyThat's right—the color trend you may have thought would dissipate post-winter is still going strong. In fact, burgundy shoes feel quite fresh for summer, and because of it, French women continue to embrace the elegant trend.Shop Burgundy Shoes for Summer Open Edit Charlie Sandals Reformation Jessie Thong Sandals Prada Double Strap Mary Jane Flats STEVE MADDEN Madison Burgundy Box Leather Loafers Explore More: French Style Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater arts. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
html:
I think we can all agree that if a cool French girl wears something, it's probably worth investing in—or at least investigating. Simply put, they have great taste and gravitate toward trends that they can wear over and over (and they do). This summer in particular, something I've noticed chic French women aren't wearing that much is black shoes. Instead, they're opting for shoes in colors that are more unexpected, that a unique touch to their summer outfits, whether they lean neutral or colorful.

The five shoe color trends, in particular, that are favorites of the French this summer are all in keeping with the overarching color trends of 2025, and even the more bold hues miraculously look good with everything. Needless to say, I don't think any fashion people in Paris are missing their black shoes this summer. Keep scrolling to shop the five main shoe color trends they're prioritizing instead.

Red

At this point, red shoes have gone from major trend to wardrobe staple. As you can see from Anne Laure-Mais here, they can completely transform an outfit in a way that few other shoe colors can. Red flats and flip-flops, in particular, are dominating this summer.

Shop Red Shoes for Summer

Open Edit

Tori Kitten Heel Sandals

Coach

Sculpted C Flat Sandals

Tory Burch

Eyelet Mary Jane Ballet Flats

Baby Blue

On the softer end of the color spectrum is baby blue, which is the shade that's captured the attention of Parisians, even more so than butter yellow and powder pink. As you can see below, they pair particularly well with white pieces.

Shop Baby Blue Shoes for Summer

Reformation

Waldena Block Heeled Mules

Nordstrom

Naiomi Ankle Strap Sandals

Christopher Esber

Jo Thong Sandals

Shopbop

Mansur Gavriel Woven Ballerina Flats

Espresso

Espresso, aka chocolate brown, continues to be the reigning neutral color trend of 2025. IMO, it makes outfits look expensive and can be worn year-round. Sounds like a must-own shoe color to me.

Shop Espresso Shoes for Summer

Sam Edelman

Elaina T-Strap Flats

Jeffrey Campbell

Chrissy Slingback Sandals

Madewell

The Ruth Ballet Flat in Woven Leather

ZARA

Wide Heeled Leather Sandals

SAINT LAURENT

Le Loafer Logo-Embellished Suede Loafers

Cream

Stark white shoes are a classic, but the more elegant option that French fashion people are opting for this summer is cream shoes. Whether in leather, mesh, or satin in the form of heels, flats, sneakers, or sandals, cream is always a smart choice for summer footwear.

Shop Cream Shoes for Summer

Jeffrey Campbell

Trustee Pumps

Franco Sarto

Destin Slingback Flats

Staud

Alba Cream Crochet Ballet Flats

Alohas

Amar Cream Leather Mules

MANGO

Leather Boat Shoes With Laces

Burgundy

That's right—the color trend you may have thought would dissipate post-winter is still going strong. In fact, burgundy shoes feel quite fresh for summer, and because of it, French women continue to embrace the elegant trend.

Shop Burgundy Shoes for Summer

Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater arts. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
